overview.business_description: Gaming and entertainment group operating casinos, slot machines, bingo, gaming halls, and online betting services in regulated markets across Spain, Italy, Latin America (Peru, Colombia, Mexico), and Portugal.
business_positives: LOW distress score of 10 - very healthy performing credit
All bonds trading ABOVE PAR (101-104) - market confidence
Recently IPO'd (Jul 2025) - public equity provides transparency and cushion
$3bn market cap equity beneath the debt
Diversified geography across Spain, Italy, LatAm, Portugal
Active M&A building scale in gaming
overview.fatal_flaw: EM exposure (LatAm) adds FX and political risk. Gaming regulation can change unexpectedly. EBITDA margin compressed to 26.8% from 28.7%.
overview.ownership: Public (MA: CIRSA on Madrid Stock Exchange). IPO completed Jul 2025.
overview.recent_news: IPO completed Jul 2025. Issued EUR 1bn Sr Secd Notes Oct 2025 (EUR 575m at 4.875% + EUR 425m FRN at E+300bps). Active M&A in Portugal (Casino da Figueira pending), Peru, Colombia, Italy.

geographic_exposure.italy: Growing presence - slots, online betting (SportItaliaBet, Eplay24)
geographic_exposure.latin_america: Peru, Colombia, Mexico - casinos, online gaming

credit_opinion.summary: Cirsa is a strong B1/BB- gaming credit with improving fundamentals. Net leverage at 3.2x is solid for the sector. All bonds trading above par (101-104) with tight yields (4.4-5.3%) reflects market confidence. Very low distress score of 10. Recent IPO provides transparency and $3bn equity cushion. Active M&A building scale across Europe and LatAm. The main risks are EM exposure (FX, political) and gaming regulation changes.
key_risks: EM exposure in LatAm adds FX and political risk
key_catalysts: Rating upgrade potential if leverage drops below 3.0x
Online gaming growth driving revenue mix improvement
Further spread tightening as post-IPO track record builds

distress_indicators.trading_signals: All bonds above par (101-104). Yields 4.4-5.3% - trading like solid BB. Very low distress score. Post-IPO equity cushion provides downside protection.
